sequences
Class Alignment

java.lang.Object
  sequences.Alignment

public class Alignment
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an alignment of sequences. A invariant of representation is that all the sequences had the same length.

Version:
1.1.1
Author:
Javier Iserte

Method Detail

addSequence

public void addSequence(Sequence seq)

removeSequence

public void removeSequence(java.lang.String Description)
Removes a sequence from the alignment. Assumes that there is not two or more sequences with the same description.

Parameters:
Description - is a String to identify a sequence.

verifyDifferentDescriptions

public boolean verifyDifferentDescriptions()
Checks that all sequences have a different description.

Returns:
true. If all of them are different, false otherwise.

apile

public DNASeq apile(GeneticCode myGC)
This method is used to create a single DNA sequence that is the consensus of all the sequences in the alignment. When the alignment is of Proteins, each sequence is back translated to DNA.

Parameters:
myGC - a genetic code. Used when proteins must be back translated to DNA.
Returns:
a DNASeq representing the consensus of the alignment.

lenght

public int lenght()
Returns:
int the length of all sequences in the alignment.

public java.util.List<Sequence> getSeq()

public void setSeq(java.util.List<Sequence> seq)
